fields.description:
h3. Summary

The new media picker doesn't respect the file upload limit set in. Settings > General > Attachment limit.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Edit/verify the "Attachment Maximum Size" setting in Settings > General configuration
 !Screenshot 2019-09-16 at 12.29.33.png|thumbnail!
 # Edit a page
 # Add an attachment(that is intentionally larger the attachment size limit) via the new media picker

h3. Expected Results
 * A message is shown advising the user that the file size of the file selected is larger than the set limit allows

h3. Actual Results
 * The media picker allows the file to be uploaded. Validation is bypassed
 !Screenshot 2019-09-16 at 12.37.30.png|thumbnail! 
 (file size of the attachment is 1MB)

h3. Notes
 * The old media picker doesn't have this issue - uploading files that exceed the set limit in the Confluence settings is not allowed
 !Screenshot 2019-09-16 at 12.31.48.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround
 * No known workarounds, if a workaround is found - then we'll add one here
 * Reach out to [https://support.atlassian.com/contact/] as a site-admin if you need to know the storage usage per space and page
fields.summary: New media picker not respecting max file size setting for attachments

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Viewing a page in Confluence New Editor that contains a PDF in a View PDF Macro causes the CPU to Spike (confirmed in macOS Mojave and Catalina)

The service name is *FirefoxCP Web Content* 

h3. Environment
* Firefox Quantum 69
* Chrome (including latest stable version - 77.0.3865.90)
* macOS 10.14 and 10.15
* New Editor

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page using the new editor
# Attach a PDF file to the page.
# Display the PDF using the PDF macro. Save.
# Visit the page, and note in Activity Monitor the CPU.

h3. Expected Results
Tested against the old editor, where my CPU spikes up to 30-40% but never higher than 100%.

h3. Actual Results
Caused a spike of up to 114% in my environment, and up to 250% in others.

h3.Notes
In Chrome, the CPU also has a spike (around 60% to 80% of CPU usage) in the latest stable version (77.0.3865.90).

h3. Workaround
Use an alternative browser.
fields.summary: VIew PDF Macro on New Editor causes CPU Spike

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Feature request made in developer support: [https://ecosystem.atlassian.net/browse/DEVHELP-3321]
{quote}In my Mind Map App, I store the mind map data in XML format in the raw body of a custom content type as proposed by the documentation: 
 "You can define custom content to support a content body with a type of raw. This is useful when you want to store, for example, stringified JSON to the content." [1]

While this works well, the raw body still gets indexed and displayed in the confluence search results. And seeing a bunch of XML code in the search results is probably confusing for the user.

I tried using the "ac:custom-content:search-body" property which states: "The content of this property will also be used in displaying the excerpt text for search result." [1] but the content of that property was only added to the excerpt text and the XML code still remained.

!Screenshot 2019-08-16 at 11.22.54.png|width=745,height=419!

My proposal is not to index/display a raw body - at least when "ac:custom-content:search-body" is set.

[1] [https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/modules/custom-content/]
{quote}
fields.summary: Don't index/display a raw body when "ac:custom-content:search-body" is set

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Users that are attaching Office Excel files to their Confluence pages are unable to preview the Excel Document while using the New Editor/old editor.

h3. Environment
- Cloud with the New Confluence Editor
- Cloud with old confluence edior
h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a New Page
# Upload an Office Excel Macro 
# Add an Office Excel Macro
# Input the Page Name, select the File Name, and click the Preview button in the macro window

h3. Expected Results
Excel File is previewed in the Macro and we will be able to insert the macro using insert button.

h3. Actual Results
No Preview is shown,will not be able to insert the macro using insert button.

Browser Console log shows:
{code}overrides.js:74 Uncaught TypeError: Cannot read property 'getCurrentTitle' of undefined
    at e.beforeParamsRetrieved (overrides.js:74)
    at Object.q [as getMacroDefinitionFromForm] (com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-macro-browser:macro-browser-js.js?externals=__local-default__&locale=en-US:74)
    at Object.previewMacro (com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-macro-browser:macro-browser-js.js?externals=__local-default__&locale=en-US:91)
    at Object.a.previewMacro (com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-macro-browser:macro-browser-js.js?externals=__local-default__&locale=en-US:129)
    at HTMLAnchorElement.<anonymous> (com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.confluence-macro-browser:macro-browser-js.js?externals=__local-default__&locale=en-US:115)
    at HTMLAnchorElement.dispatch (jquery-min.js:1)
    at HTMLAnchorElement.a (jquery-min.js:1){code}

h3. Notes
Preview seems to work while using the Old Editor and if No Page Name is Specified (in the New Editor)

If the Excel Macro is added immediately to the page after Drag and Dropping the Excel file, the preview will not render.  User will need to first publish the page after uploading the Excel file and then edit the page to add the macro.

h3. Workaround

Leave the "Page Name" field blank and/or insert the Macro and the Editor should render a preview (only after the page has been published after the attachment has been uploaded)
fields.summary: Unable to Preview Excel Document using Excel Macro in New Editor

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
 
In Confluence's new editor when inserting more than one *Filter result*s macro the page will only display two issues for the filter regardless of how many issues are returned. 

The macro paging will also not be shown.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Confluence page in the new editor.
 # Add two Filter result macros and reference a JIRA filter.

h3. Expected Results

The two macros should display the filter results just fine.

h3. Actual Results

The first macro display the results fine together with the macro pagination:
 !image-2019-09-13-18-22-24-818.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Notes

The issue may not affect all macros as sometimes the first macro to be displayed correctly load all issues fine.

h3. Workaround

Replace the *JIRA filter* macros for *JIRA Issue/Filter* macros inserting the filter JQLs directly at the macro.
fields.summary: JIRA filter result macro only displays two issues in Confluence

fields.description:
Currently in Confluence, if you are entering a comment, and you hit Ctrl-S to save it, it deletes the entire comment and does not save it.

I understand why this happens - Confluence thinks you are saving the page, not the comment, then it does a refresh and the comment is gone.

However I tend to make this mistake frequently, as Ctrl-S is the global convention for saving. I am sure many others do the same! (Do you?)
fields.summary: In Confluence, Ctrl-S should save your current comment and not delete it!

Firefox 69.0

 # Add some contents below the table
 # Add another table
 # Try to use the up arrow to go back up one line.

h3. Actual Results

h3. Workaround

h3. Issue Summary

Placing the style macro makes the table of contents (ToC) macro unavailable.


h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page which contains the table of contents macro, a header, and the style macro.
# Publish the page and click the link of the table of contents macro

h3. Expected Results

You can jump to the target header when you clicked the ToC link.
The link looks like below:
https://example29nov.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/~656289383/pages/43352094/ToC+with+Style+Macro#ToCwithStyleMacro-H2.DEF

h3. Actual Results

The link looks like below and it doesn't jump to the target header.
https://example29nov.atlassian.net/wiki/content-only/viewpage.action?pageId=43352094&iframeId=fallback-mode&xdm_e=https://example29nov.atlassian.net/&xsm_c=fallback-mode-fake-key__9504571234943049&cp=/wiki&cv=0.0.0-fallback-mode&lic=none#ToCwithStyleMacro-H2.DEF
OR

all links are not showing in view mode, it is working fine in the firefox.
No error is recorded in the browser console.

h3. Workaround

None. Consider adding yourself as a watcher to be kept informed as to the state of the bug moving forward. With that way, if our development team updates the ticket, you'll be notified via email.
fields.summary: The style macro breaks ToC links

fields.description:
h3.Summary
Users included in a group with *Administration Access* to Confluence, but, no *Product Access* will not be able to access Confluence and be counted towards the billing.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# As a Cloud administrator, create a group, for example, "admin-group"
# Go to the site administration/user management (https://example.atlassian.net/admin) and select *Product Access*.
# Select *Administration access* and add the "admin-group" to the *Confluence* part. Make sure that this group is not included in the *Product access* option for Confluence.
# Add a test user to this group. Make sure that the user is only part of this group and no other groups with access to Confluence.
# Have the user trying to access Confluence.

h3. Expected Results
The user should be able to access Confluence. From the *Administration access* page in the user management, it states the following:
{quote}
All Confluence Administration groups will be given product access to Confluence, even if they are removed from the product access page.
{quote}

h3. Actual Results
The user is not able to access Confluence. If not, the user should not be counted towards the bill.

h3. Workaround
Add the group to the *Product Access* part for Confluence instead of the *Administration access* only.
fields.summary: User that has only administration access cannot access Confluence and is included in the billing

fields.description:
h3. *Problem Definition*

When a Confluence space import fails, the error message usually is a generic one: "Transaction rolled back because it has been marked as rollback-only".

This often doesn't reflect the real reason for the import to fail.

h3. *Suggested Solution*

It would be nice that the error showing in the UI reflects the actual exception that caused the import to fail to import.

h3. Workaround

Contact Support.
fields.summary: Improve error message for Confluence space import failure

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If a User uses the keyboard shortcut/markdown, [] , to create a Task in a bottom of the page comment, when the comment is saved, a 500 Error is displayed and the comment is not saved

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# On a page in Confluence, type in [] to insert a Task (the task does not need to be assigned)
# Save the Comment

-- We would expect the [] shortcut to not convert create a task (tested in Conf Server  7.0.1 and this is what occurred, the brackets did not convert)

- If a Task can now be created as part of a Bottom of the Page Comment, we would expect that the comment is saved successfully

h3. Actual Results
 !image-2019-09-12-14-55-37-647.png|thumbnail! 

Browser console shows a few errors:

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
Currently, on the page properties report macro, the message "No content found." is shown if there's no resulting pages with a Page Properties macro, even if there're pages with the specific label set on the report.

h3. Suggested Solution
Inform there're some pages found but there's no Page Properties macro on them.
fields.summary: Improve the "No content found" message on the page properties report macro

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

We have been noticed about multiple different customers reporting that the page header, in the published mode, is missing for some pages, so they are unable to edit the pages.
h3. Environment
 * Cloud

h3. Workaround
*Clear all the temporary data for the page.*

If you're on Chrome, you can follow the steps below:
 # Access one of the pages on Confluence where you noticed the problem;
 # Go to the browser's menu and select *View* -> *Developer* -> * Developer Tools*
 # Open the *Application* tab and select * Clear Storage* on the left;
 # Hit the *Clear Site Data* button;
 !Screen Shot 2019-09-13 at 20.02.47.png|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Missing header in published pages

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Due to GDPR changes email address is not longer exported in a Confluence cloud space export, instead the Atlassian Account ID is present.

This is the case even if the the exported is done by a site admin. 

As a result the importing the space into Confluence server fails as the email is required for user mapping. 

h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Confluence cloud site. 
 # Create a space.
 # Have multiple users create content within the space. 
 # Create a confluence server instance. 
 # Add the same users to the Confluence server instance that contributed to the Confluence space in cloud.
 # Export the space from Confluence cloud.
 # Import the space into Confluence server.

h3. Expected Results
The space is imported successfully and the user data contained in the space export is correctly mapped to the users in the Confluence server instance. 

h3. Actual Results
The export fails due to Confluence server being unable to match the users based on the Atlassian Account ID contained in the export from Confluence cloud as it expecting an email address. 
The below exception is thrown in the xxxxxxx.log file:
{noformat}

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition
* When choosing a file to upload, the media picker allows you to work on the page while content is being uploaded
* If the page is published before the media has finished uploading, then there is a message displayed,  but the message doesn't provide any details as to why there is a delay
 !Screenshot 2019-09-06 at 15.15.49.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Suggested Solution
*  Change the wording and add extra information E.g. "Waiting for <file_name> to finish uploading - x% remaining(1minute)"

h3. Why this is important
* It's not obvious what is causing the page to not publish/hang
* The page hangs without any further information relating to pending uploads - only "Hold up! We're saving your page"
* The current message would be interpreted as there is something going wrong(timeout) and not an expected message if there are pending uploads
* There could be a timeout and the user would be unaware
 
h3. Workaround 
* Scroll down and check if there are any pending media uploads
fields.summary: When uploading media, provide more feedback as to the progress of the uploads when publishing page

fields.description:
{panel:title=Status Update 29 October 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ff7f7f|titleBGColor=#ff7f7f|bgColor=#e5e5e5}
Hi all,

I'm a product manager on the Editor. Thank you for sharing your feedback and requests. We hear you, and are making improvements to Lists now and in the future. At the moment we've been working on making the Lists feature generally more reliable and less buggy (releasing soon!) - so it's more predictable when you switch between bulleted/numbered; when you indent/outdent, backspace/delete, and copy/paste. These are foundational improvements that we've been making to Lists, in order that we can next make them more flexible and add much-requested features in - such as putting content inside a numbered list and not breaking the numbering!

Next up, our team will be working on another much requested feature - undo/redo buttons in the toolbar. After that, we'll come back to this List request, and other List requests, to make them more flexible and more usable - focusing on top user requests like nesting content in a list, continue/restart numbering, start from an indent, etc. We will keep you updated as we get more detailed on what exactly we will do and when.

Thank you again for your feedback!

Rachel
{panel}
{panel:title=Status Update 13 March 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9|titleBGColor=#ebf2f9|bgColor=#ffffff}
As we're working through this feature and others, we wanted to address a lot of your concerns as to the future of the new editor and legacy editor.

Please read our recent community post here: [https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Confluence-Cloud-articles/Change-to-your-content-is-in-your-hands/ba-p/1324476]

Thanks,
 Avinoam
{panel}
h3. Description
{quote}"In the previous version of Confluence, you were able to easy move and place the info panel between a number list without breaking the sequence. The new version doesn't allow the number list to continue when inserting the info panel... It resets the numbers."
{quote}
By being able to insert macros between numbered lists, some of them allowed different content to be placed inside (I.E. tables) and useful information that would be tied to the specific number of the list. This request also applies to codes when inserted in the numbered list.

It would be very useful to have this feature back in the fabric editor.

This also affects the Bullet List. Macros cannot be added to bulleted lists as well.

 
h4. Workaround

Use a table with the *Numbering columns* feature on tables. By doing so, you can put any amount of content that you prefer inside a single cell, and then, jump to the next one that would be the next in the numbering list order. 

 

Additionally, images can be added to a numbered lists directly. Inline images can be inserted as emojis.
fields.summary: Bring back the option to add macros within a numbered or bulleted list

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Multiple Template variables with the same name will block saving updates to the template when editing an existing one.

h3. Environment

New editor for templates.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

Replication Method #1

- Create a new template.
- Create a new variable, then add another instance of that same variable somewhere else in the template.
- Save the template.
- Edit that template.
- Make no changes, then click "Save"

Replication Method #2

*These steps require using two different methods of creating multiple instances of a variable.*
- If you copy a variable from the template, then delete everything on the template page, then paste the variable many times, it will let you save. but if you paste that variable, then use the macro menu and add the New Variable macro with the same name, it won't let you save.
- Alternatively, if you start with a clean template and you use the macro menu to create a variable, you can use that method infinitely for the same variable name, and it would allow you to save. but if you add a new variable from the macro menu, then copy paste that macro anywhere, it won't let you save.

h3. Expected Results
 The page saves normally.

h3. Actual Results

The page does not save, and this error pops up:
{quote}
Can't save changes

Multiple template variables which have the same name "Test" but different parameters.
{quote}


(Optional - If Necessary)
h3. Workaround

Editing and "saving" each of the duplicated variables will fix the issue that causes the editor to think they have different parameters, and will allow saving of the page, however, it will only allow it for that particular save.
fields.summary: Multiple copies of a variable with the same name in the new template editor will not save until editing and saving each copy

fields.description:
There were instances where pages in TinyMCE was being unable to be created / published due to the exceeding limit of the localstorage. These are some of the measures that are suggested to be implemented
 * Put analytics in place for monitoring browser storage exceeding quota.
 * Put logging in place to let us know when an “unsafe” storage operation is being invoked. That will allow us to have a number to track for safeguarding browser storage access across the codebase
 * Design the functionality to allow user-recovery. For example, whenever we detect that a storage quota has been exceeded - we let the user know, and propose a remediation for cleaning the storage. We also let the user know that their page will be reloaded as a consequence, and that unsaved progress could be lost as part of that. That way [@pwb|https://atlassian.slack.com/team/WEKGU7VA7] would have been able to recover from that without alerting the dev team — we would be alerted by the analytics and logging put in place via previous bullet point
fields.summary: Improve browser's localstorage exceeding threshold

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Space permission header's wording seems switched as confirmed from aria attributes and rest endpoint response:
 * Space Permission

!SpacePermission-headers-switched.png|width=818,height=278!
 * Rest endpoint response

!SpacePermission-headers-switched-restResponse.png|width=848,height=356!

That is, the first header should be about "Document Read Request" and not "Document Read Confirmation" and vice versa.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install a Confluence Connect app that has at least two custom content types with configurable space permissions (apiSupport.supportedSpacePermissions = ["create", "read", "delete"] in the descriptor, docs for those fields are here [https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/modules/custom-content/]). You can use our app Scroll Documents for Confluence Cloud to test this ([https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1217608/scroll-documents-for-confluence?hosting=cloud]), which is also where we encountered the problem, although I think it's not specific to this app.
 # Go to the page for configuring add-on space permissions (Space Setting > Permissions > Add-on, /spaces/addonpermissions.action?key=<space-key>).
 # Change the space permissions for the first custom content type (Document Read Confirmations in our app) and observe the effect (you can check it through the REST API /rest/api/space/<space-key>?expand=permissions)
 # Do the same thing for the second content type (Document Read Requests in our app) and observe the effect.

h3. Expected Results

The cells under the header text for the first type (Document Read Confirmations) control the permissions of the first type and the cells under the header text for the second type (Document Read Requests) control the permissons of the second type.
h3. Actual Results

The relationships or headers are reversed. Concretely, the cells under "Document Read Confirmations" control the read request permissions and the cells under "Document Read Requests" control the read confirmation permissions.
h3. Notes
 * From vendor: _Note that you can also see that something is wrong by inspecting the DOM tree in your browser. The table cells have a data-permission attribute that identifies the permission that they control. See if it matches what the header says._
 * From vendor: _This issue very confusing to the user and may lead to accidental misconfiguration._

h3. Workaround

Assume that the second column is the first column
fields.summary: Space permissions for an add-on custom content are incorrect

fields.description:
We regularly put command outputs or examples in the code macro and set it collapsible so that the reading flow is not interrupted by it, but the new code snippet has no option for this.

With the new code snippet, you can only set the language, while in the older code macro you could also control the line numbering, theme and set it collapsible.

Allowing to set the title is important in relation with the collapsible feature as it makes it more clear what the code block was about without having to expand it.

Controlling line numbers is useful when you put in clear text or commands itself, for which you often don't want to show line numbers. In other cases you do want to show the line numbers but control the starting number. For instance when it is part of a larger block of code.

Themes are used by us to differentiate between  output extracts (using a dark background to mimic a console screen) and examples of commands that must be used or plain text (using a white background).
While perhaps less important than the collapse feature, it was something that was available and actively used, and I don't understand why this general dumbing down and taking away control from the users was done.
fields.summary: Code snippet lacks crucial functionality existing in previous code macro

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Creating a table that is horizontally extended and setting the first column as header doesn't get the header fixed when scrolling the table to the right side.

h3. Environment
* Cloud
* Old Editing Experience

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page;
# Insert a table with 15 columns;
# Fill the columns and rows with some text content until they get horizontally extended enough to scroll the table to the right;
# Set the first column as a header;
# Publish the page and scroll the table to the right.

h3. Expected Results
The column you set as the header is fixed while you are scrolling the table to the side.

h3. Actual Results
All the content is scrolled.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Heading Column doesn't work scrolling the table horizontally
Table row headers doesn't get fixed when there are more than a Page Layout

fields.description:
h4. Suggestion
Bring back the symbols option, like *registered* ®, trademark and copyright(IP symbols), instead of emojis like they are currently in the fabric editor.
 Currently is not possible to use those like it was in tiny editor(it was smaller). Symbol are bigger in fabric (as they only have the option to be inserted as an emoji) and superscript does not work with it.

h4. Workaround
On {color:#FF8B00}macOS{color}, type *CTRL + CMD + Space*. An emoji pop-up will display. You can select *>>* in order to expand the menu and reveal non-emoji symbols which can be used in your page.

On {color:#FF8B00}Windows{color}, open the *Character Map* and use it to find and insert your symbol. It will also teach you the proper key combination to use in case you want to type the characters quickly in the future. For more information, watch the video [How to Use Character Map in Windows 10 / 8.1 / 8 / 7 / XP Tutorial|https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=38bTwllsnDw].
fields.summary: Symbols in fabric editor

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When editing certain templates (such as Meeting Notes ), the $currentUser and $currentDate variables are gone - even if you don't touch them.

 

 

This was reported for Meeting Notes as part of https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-67020

This ticket is to fix for all other first party blueprints / templates.
h3. Expected Results

Both template variables are presented there, so you can change the rest of the template and save it. After that, creating a new page from the template will fill the current date and the participant name as the current user.
h3. Actual Results

The template variables are gone and you must fill the information manually when creating a new page from the template.
h3. Workaround

Manually add the template variables when you are editing the template.
fields.summary: Template variables from Certain templates are gone if you edit the template

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

Confluence Administrators would like to globally apply 24 hour/military time to all of their Users when using Team Calendars for Confluence when adding Calendar Events

Team Calendars can be [configured to globally display|https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=960163482] in 24hr while in viewing Events on the Calendar View, however, this does not change the Time format used when a User inputs the time for their Calendar Event
h3. Suggested Solution

Include an option that will allow Confluence Admins to enable either 12 hour AM/PM or 24 hour/military time as a Default for their Users when adding Calendar Events
h3. Workaround

Individual Users can update their User Profile Settings (access id.atlassian.com > Profile Picture > Manage your account > Account Preferences) and change their language from English (US) to English (UK) to display the time in Create Event to be in 24 hour/military time format
fields.summary: Globally Apply 24 Hour Time When Creating an Event in Team Calendars

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Received an email that something had changed on a Confluence Cloud page.

The email is huge, all the images are broken and there is no apparent change.

It is also missing the usual 3 colored box key at the top for changed, added and deleted.
h3. Environment
 * OS X Desktop Email
 * iPhone email

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Open an email about a page changing

h3. Expected Results
 * There should be an indication of what changed
 * Images should be visible

h3.  
h3. Actual Results
 * No images in Desktop or iPhone
 * No apparent indication of what changed

h3. Notes

This is different than the previous ticket about just images not showing.
 In this issue, the images don't show on either desktop or mobile and there is no indication of changes or a change key.

 
h3. Workaround
 * Follow link to page, look at page history and compare

 

 

 
h3. Attachments:
 * OS X Desktop view of email
 * iPhone view of email
fields.summary: Email about what changed shows no change

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The *Balsamiq* add-on is still being affected by this closed bug: [CONFCLOUD\-67410: Balsamiq, Draw.io & Gliffy Diagrams doesn't load with Jira Issue Macro|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-67410 ]

The diagram is added to the page, but doesn't load in the published version of the page - the browser console keeps getting a lot of 400 errors trying to load it.

h3. Steps to Reproduce

* Create a page
* Add both Jira Issue Macro & Balsamiq 
* Publish the page

h3. Expected Results

* Both Jira issue macro & Balsamiq gets published

h3. Actual Results

Only the Jira Issue is published. 

h3. Notes
* The other two add-ons *Gliffy and Draw.io* are working fine;
* On Firefox, it seems to work sometimes - not the ideal, because it is needed to refresh the page a couple of times until it gets loaded.

h3. Workaround

Jira Issue can be added as a comment on to the Confluence Page to load the Balsamiq Published Mode
fields.summary: Balsamiq diagrams doesn't load with Jira Issue Macro

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When viewing a page with any Google Drive for Confluence (Official) macro on it, It will give an error indicating that the object cannot be rendered if you do not have access. Logging in with an account that does not have access will show a red lock, a "Switch account" button, and an "Open in <google application>" button. If you click either the "Open in ..." or the "switch Account", you will be redirected to "https://confluencegd.us-west-1.prod.public.atl-paas.net/login?jwt=undefined" where there will be an error.
 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Ensure that you have two google accounts that you can use.
 # Create a page and add a google document such as sheets, doc, or slides and add it in a Google Drive for confluence (official) macro.
 # Share the document in a way that restricts at least one user you have access to from viewing the document.
 # attempt to view the document in confluence as the user that should not have access.
 # Attempt to change accounts in Confluence.

h3. Expected Results

You should get the login page to allow you to change Google Accounts.

h3. Actual Results

You get this error page instead:
 !Google Error.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround

If you are able to edit the page, in the macro preview, if you try to change accounts while editing the macro from the macro preview, you can actually change accounts to get access to the Google Drive object.
fields.summary: When viewing a page with the Google Drive for Confluence (Official) macro, the "switch accounts" button redirects to an error page if you do not have access to view the document

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
New pages created from templates that were previously created using the legacy editor are opening in the new editing experience. This is causes issues with rendering unsupported content as well as formatting. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page using a template that was created using the legacy editor

h3. Expected Results
New page is created using the legacy editor and formatting and content are rendered as expected.

h3. Actual Results
Various formatting elements are not displayed correctly. In addition, unsupported content fails to populate and the following error is displayed.

{code}ConfluenceADFMigrationUnsupportedContentInternalExtension{code}

 !Screen Shot 2019-09-05 at 5.05.15 pm.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available

fields.summary: Images not loading in Confluence

fields.description:
My understanding is that restricted pages are currently searchable by users who have access to the restricted pages, but not site-admins (confluence-administrators group). Though confluence-administrators DO have access to the restricted pages if they access the restricted page directly. Can this be adjusted so confluence-administrators also have access to the portion of the search index which contains restricted pages?

One use case is for lite e-Discovery (something Confluence does not provide natively). If a Confluence site has a large number of restricted pages, it is practically impossible for an authorized account to search for content relevant to an e-Discovery search.
fields.summary: Allow confluence-administrators to search for restricted page content

fields.description: It would be very useful if Page Tree doesn't collapse while opening a new page from the currently opened page. This would make things easy if the page tree has multiple pages so that the user doesn't have to expand the page tree again to find the root location.
fields.summary: Page Tree Collapse while reloading or opening a new page

{panel:title=Status Update 13 March 2020|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ff7f7f|titleBGColor=#ff7f7f|bgColor=#e5e5e5}

As we're working through this feature and others, we wanted to address a lot of your concerns as to the future of the new editor and legacy editor.

Please read our recent community post here: https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Confluence-Cloud-articles/Change-to-your-content-is-in-your-hands/ba-p/1324476

Thanks,
Avinoam

fields.description:
{panel:title=Status Update 4 August 2021|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ff7f7f|titleBGColor=#ff7f7f|bgColor=#e5e5e5}
Hi everyone,

This is Neha from the Confluence team. We would like to thank you for all the comments on the current need to be able to reliably create multiple Jira issues from a table. The current behavior where multiple issues from a table are created but do not get updated to the table in Confluence is expected for the scenarios listed below:

1.) If the selected text has a line break
 2.) If the selected text spans multiple table columns or rows
 3.) If the selected text consists of only whitespaces
 4.) If the selected text is no longer found on the page / blog
 5.) if the page / blog has been deleted
 6.) If the page / blog has been modified since loading
 7.) If the user no longer has permission to edit the page / blog
 8.) If the table does not have a header

We are going to update this bug to focus on surfacing these various error conditions in Confluence and making the error messages user friendly and clear. Thank you again for your feedback on the unexpected behavior happening with creating multiple Jira issues from a table!

-Neha
{panel}
h3.  Issue Summary

This feature of creating JIRA issues from a table seems to be not working for now. Though the issues are created in JIRA, they are not linked in the Confluence page we just created.
h3. Environment
 * Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce

[^How to replicate the bug.mp4]
h3. Expected Results

The JIRA issues you just created are linked in the Confluence page as JIRA links.
h3. Actual Results

The text you selected to create the JIRA issues is intact.
h3. Workaround

You can create each issue separately.
fields.summary: Create Multiple JIRA issues from table is not linking the tickets on the Confluence page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When we have a few headers in a page, it is possible to use the header as an anchor link: [https://INSTANCE.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/SPACEKEY/pages/CONTENTID/PAGE_TITLE#PAGE_TITLE-HEADER|https://instance.atlassian.net/wiki/spaces/SPACEKEY/pages/CONTENTID/PAGE_TITLE#PAGE_TITLE-HEADER]
 However, this link will only bring you to the header in case it is on the same page as the header - placing this link on a different page will only bring you to the top f the page.
h3. Environment
 * Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page with some paragraphs and add a header 1 in the bottom of the page;
 # In the top of the page, insert a ToC macro - just to have the header link easier;
 # Publish the page;
 # Copy the header link from the ToC;
 # Create a new page and insert paste the link;
 # Publish the page;
 # Click over the link you just inserted.

h3. Expected Results

You are redirected to the page header from the link, placed in the bottom of the first created page.
h3. Actual Results

You are just redirected to the page.
h3. Workaround
h5. Legacy Editor
 * Using the [Anchor Macro|https://confluence.atlassian.com/doc/anchor-macro-182682072.html] in conjunction with the target page's headers will allow you to reference the Anchor name from a separate page.

h5. New Editor
 * Since the Anchor Macro is not available in the new Confluence editing experience, there is no workaround for the new editing experience.  (Existing feature request: CONFCLOUD-69198)
fields.summary: Anchor links from a page placed in another one don't redirect to the anchor link

# Create 'Page 2' and add attachment macro with Page Title parameter 'Page 1'
# Access Page 2 and edit the Word file through the Attachment macro using Atlassian Companion.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
In the old editor, if you were to apply the *Style Macro* to a page that contains the Table of Contents Macro, the links in the TOC macro start to look something like this:

https://[INSTANCE-NAME].atlassian.net/wiki/content-only/viewpage.action?pageId=#######&iframeId=fallback-mode&xdm_e=https://[INSTANCE-NAME].atlassian.net/&xsm_c=fallback-mode-fake-key__35744805383746914&cp=/wiki&cv=0.0.0-fallback-mode&lic=none#[PAGE-NAME]-[HEADING]

Thus, users aren't able to right-click this in order to get an absolute link for use on another page.

h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud
Old Editor
Confirmed in both the latest Firefox and Chrome

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a new page
# Add blank Style Macro (this can be anywhere on the page)
# Add TOC Macro
# Add some headings
# Save
# Right-click a link from the TOC macro and select Copy Link

h3. Expected Results
# Absolute URL would be copied with #Anchor suffix

h3. Actual Results
URL like the one I shared above is obtained instead

h3. Notes
Since Style Macro has been [removed in the new editor|https://confluence.atlassian.com/confcloud/we-re-cleaning-up-the-macro-browser-946028471.html], it's likely this will not affect future versions. I've reported this for accountability.

h3. Workaround
No known workaround.
fields.summary: Style macro removes absolute links from Table of Contents

fields.description:
h3. Summary
If you add individual page permission to a restricted page, the user will not be able to view the result of the Page Properties Report macro. 

h3. Environment
Cloud

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Add a Page properties macro to _Page 1_
# Add a Page Restriction to _Page 1_ to allow 'User A' and 'group-abc'
# Add a label 'test' to _Page 1_
# Add a Page Properties Report macro to _Page 2_ 
# Add the same label 'test' into the Page Properties Report macro 
# Login as User A and try to view _Page 2_

h3. Expected Results
- The user who can access the pages with Page Properties macro should be able to see the result in the Page Properties Report macro

h3. Actual Results
- If you add individual page permission to a restricted page, the user will not be able to view the result of the Page Properties Report macro. 


h3. Workaround
- Use group permission instead of individual user permission.
fields.summary: Page Properties Report macro doesn't work properly for restricted pages

fields.description:
The timeout value of the compare page versions is locked at 40 seconds. If a page has enough content in it or enough differences between versions, then the diff may take more than the 40 seconds to create.

I would like to propose that the performance of the diff operation for the "compare selected versions" functionality be reviewed and improved if possible.
fields.summary: Improve performance of compare page versions
